title: 109_s1360
content: The "Domestic Partner Health Benefits Equity Act" extends exclusions for amounts received through accident or health insurance for medical care expenses. It also extends exclusions for employer contributions to accident and health plans. Effective date is after December 31, 2005. Section 106 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to include coverage for eligible beneficiaries of employees in employer accident or health plans. The amendment applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2005. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to allow deductions for health insurance costs of self-employed individuals who are employees. The amendment applies to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2005. SEC. 5. Extension of sick and accident benefits for members of a voluntary employees' beneficiary association and their dependents. The term 'dependents' now includes eligible beneficiaries for sick and accident benefits. Effective for taxable years after December 31, 2005. SEC. 6. Amendments to various definitions. The amendment excludes certain amounts from wages for FICA purposes, defining dependents to include eligible beneficiaries as defined by the employer. This also applies to medical or hospitalization expenses under the Social Security Act. The amendment expands the definition of dependents to include eligible beneficiaries as defined by the employer for medical or hospitalization expenses under the Railroad Retirement Act. The amendment expands the definition of dependents to include eligible beneficiaries for medical or hospitalization expenses under the Railroad Retirement Act, effective for remuneration paid after December 31, 2005.
